page.title: 19World War 2's Effect on Rye
page.content: During the War Rye was quite a big target for the Germans because it was just across the coast. Many people were evacuated until the end of the war. The cinema was bombed but it was built again after the war and it was the first cinema newly built in England. The nearest doodlebug to fall was at Cadborough Cliff. When Rye was evacuated the Grammar School was moved to Bedford. Forty years ago there was only one pottery in Rye and now there are many. The Post Office was in the High Street. The estate opposite Fread Gardham School was built in 1936. Also after the war there many jobs for rebuilding places and in farming.
